code: @Manual{,   title = {CSwR: Companion package for the book "Computational Statistics with R"},   author = {Niels Richard Hansen and Johan Larsson},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.2.9000},   url = {https://jolars.github.io/CSwR-Package/}, }

title: Companion package for the book
text: CSwR package companion book Computational Statistics R available cswr.nrhstat.org. provides data utility functions used throughout book teaching computational statistics concepts.

title: Companion package for the book
text: can install development version GitHub:

title: Companion package for the book
text: package includes: Datasets: Five datasets used examples throughout book: greenland - Monthly temperature data southwest Greenland (1873-2013) nuuk - Annual temperature summaries Nuuk (1867-2013) vegetables - Weekly frozen vegetable sales data angle - Torsion angles protein structure (1HMP) news - Social media news sharing features Mashable articles Tracer objects (tracer()) - Collect, print, visualize trace information function evaluation debugging performance analysis Terminator objects (terminator()) - Define termination conditions iterative algorithms callback support Random number streams (rng_stream()) - Efficient cached random number generation Force evaluation (force_all()) - Utility force evaluation function arguments avoid lazy evaluation pitfalls Plotter expressions (plotter()) - Create expressions iterative plot updates long-running computations

title: Companion package for the book
code: library(CSwR)  # Load and explore datasets data(greenland) head(greenland) Year Month Temp_nuuk Temp_Qaqortoq Temp_diff 1 1873     1     -12.1          -9.9      -2.2 2 1874     1     -13.1         -11.6      -1.5 3 1875     1      -6.6          -6.3      -0.3 4 1876     1     -11.1          -8.3      -2.8 5 1877     1     -14.5          -8.8      -5.7 6 1878     1      -7.7          -6.8      -0.9 # Create a tracer for monitoring algorithm progress tr <- tracer(c("x", "residual"), time = TRUE) # Use tr$tracer as a callback in your iterative function  # Set up a terminator with a convergence condition term <- terminator(cond = quote(residual < 1e-6), Delta = 10) # Returns TRUE when condition is met

Force evaluation of all arguments to a function — force_all
text: ... arguments captured ... also evaluated passed via ...

title: Force evaluation of all arguments to a function — force_all
text: NULL invisibly

title: Force evaluation of all arguments to a function — force_all
text: Use force_all() syntactic sugar force evaluation arguments function thereby circumvent lazy evaluation. called within function ... formal argument, use force_all(...) force evaluation arguments captured ....

title: Force evaluation of all arguments to a function — force_all
code: affine <- function(a, b) {   function(x) a * x + b } a <- 1 b <- 1 affine_11 <- affine(a, b) a <- 2 b <- 2 affine_11(1) # Gives 4 and not 2 due to lazy evaluation #> [1] 4  affine_forced <- function(a, b) {   force_all()   function(x) a * x + b } a <- 1 b <- 1 affine_11 <- affine_forced(a, b) a <- 2 b <- 2 affine_11(1) # Gives 2 #> [1] 2

title: Social media news sharing — news
text: dataset containing features articles published Mashable period two years January 7, 2013, January 7, 2015. purpose collecting data predict number shares news articles social networks. Compared source, seven features excluded. Two (url timestamp) relevant predictors five redundant almost redundant, leading collinearity.

what: Constructor of a terminator object — terminator
title: Constructor of a terminator object — terminator
text: Terminator objects used write termination conditions can tested via callback function within another function evaluation.

title: Constructor of a terminator object — terminator
code: terminator(cond = FALSE, Delta = 1, print = TRUE, plotter = NULL, ...)

title: Constructor of a terminator object — terminator
text: cond termination condition. Either expression call evaluates logical. Delta integer specifying often termination condition evaluated. Delta = 0 means never, otherwise condition evaluated every Delta-th iteration. Delta = 1 default. print variable name print logical. FALSE, nothing printed. variable name given, variable (exists) printed every Delta-th iteration. TRUE (default) last variable cond printed every Delta-th iteration. plotter expression, possibly created plotter function. ... arguments passed format printing plot.window

title: Constructor of a terminator object — terminator
text: terminator object containing functions terminator clear.

title: Constructor of a terminator object — terminator
text: Terminator objects similar tracer objects serve different purpose. Like tracer objects, can used trace, print plot values variable within evaluation environment another function evaluation. primary purpose terminator object , however, evaluate termination condition, can trigger termination loop. Terminator objects save trace information trace runtime.

what: Constructor of a tracer object — tracer
title: Constructor of a tracer object — tracer
text: Tracer objects can collect, print summarize trace information evaluation environment functions evaluation.

title: Constructor of a tracer object — tracer
code: tracer(   objects = NULL,   Delta = 1,   save = TRUE,   time = TRUE,   expr = NULL,   plotter = NULL,   ... )

title: Constructor of a tracer object — tracer
text: objects character vector names objects traced. objects searched calling environment tracer function. Objects created expr argument can also traced. Delta integer specifying often trace information printed. Delta = 0 means never, otherwise trace information printed every Delta-th iteration. Delta = 1 default. save logical value. Determines trace information stored. time logical value. Determines runtime information seconds traced. expr expression evaluated environment calling environment tracer function parent. plotter expression, possibly created plotter function. ... arguments passed format printing plot.window

title: Constructor of a tracer object — tracer
text: tracer object containing functions tracer, get clear.

title: Constructor of a tracer object — tracer
text: function tracer constructs tracer object containing tracer, get clear function. call objects tracer function can inserted functions used collect, print plot trace information internals function evaluation. objects get function can access information afterwards, clear function deletes stored values tracer object. tracer object can trace time (seconds) tracer calls, measured hires_time function bench package. print summary methods available summarizing trace information. call tracer function can manually inserted body function traced, can inserted using base::trace, can passed argument function callback argument.

title: Constructor of a tracer object — tracer
